xxl.core.math.numerics.splines
Class RB1CubicBezierSpline

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.Function<Number,Double>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
          xxl.core.math.numerics.splines.CubicBezierSpline
              xxl.core.math.numerics.splines.RB1CubicBezierSpline
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, RealFunction
public class RB1CubicBezierSpline
extends CubicBezierSpline

This class implements a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition. Thus, the abstract class CubicBezierSpline is implemented. Since there are most of the variables precomputed, this class only implements the method solveLGS. This method solves a linear equation system whose solution uniquely determines the Bezier-coefficients. For solving the linear equation system a modified version of the Gauss algorithm is used because the system contains a tridiagonal matrix and this permits an efficient computation.

See Also:
CubicBezierSpline, RB2CubicBezierSpline, Maths.triDiagonalGaussianLGS(double[],double[],double[],double[]), Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

RB1CubicBezierSpline

public RB1CubicBezierSpline(double[] grid,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            boolean cdfMode)
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. A flag cdfMode indicates whether the spline is in cdf mode or not, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0.

Parameters:
grid - grid points, i.e., corresponding x values for the given function values
fvalues - function values at the grid points
cdfMode - indicates if the spline is in cdf mode

RB1CubicBezierSpline

public RB1CubicBezierSpline(double a,
                            double b,
                            int n,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            boolean cdfMode)
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition based upon an equidistant grid and the corresponding function values. A flag cdfMode indicates whether the spline is in cdf mode or not, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0.

Parameters:
a - left border of the grid
b - right border of the grid
n - number of grid points
fvalues - function values at the grid points
cdfMode - indicates spline is in cdf mode

RB1CubicBezierSpline

public RB1CubicBezierSpline(double[] grid,
                            double[] fvalues)
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. Initially, the cdf mode is set to false.

Parameters:
grid - grid points, i.e., corresponding x values for the given function values
fvalues - function values at the grid points

RB1CubicBezierSpline

public RB1CubicBezierSpline(double a,
                            double b,
                            int n,
                            double[] fvalues)
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition based upon an equidistant grid and the corresponding function values. Initially, the cdf mode is set to false.

Parameters:
a - left border of the grid
b - right border of the grid
n - number of grid points
fvalues - function values at the grid points

solveLGS

protected double[] solveLGS()
Solves the linear system of equations for the first boundary condition with a modified algorithm of Gauss.

solution of the linear equation system
